Konferensi bidang ilmu sosial dan humaniora
Machine Learning Approach for Smart City Development
A Comprehensive Study on IoT Integration and Data Analytics
Dr. Ahmad Sutanto, Prof. Sri Wahyuni, M.Eng, Dr. Bambang Priyanto
International Conference on Information and Communication Technology
Prof. Dr. Ir. Wisnu Jatmiko, M.Eng.
Proceedings of the 2024 International Conference on Information and Communication Technology
Machine Learning, IoT, Smart City, Data Analytics
machine learning, smart city, IoT, artificial intelligence, data analytics, urban computing

Penelitian ini mengeksplorasi penerapan machine learning dalam pengembangan smart city melalui integrasi teknologi IoT dan analisis data untuk menciptakan sistem urban yang lebih efisien dan berkelanjutan.

Abstract

This paper presents a comprehensive study on the application of machine learning techniques in smart city development through IoT integration and data analytics. The research focuses on developing efficient algorithms for urban data processing, real-time decision-making systems, and predictive analytics for city management.

Key Contributions:

  • Novel machine learning framework for smart city data processing
  • IoT integration architecture for real-time urban monitoring
  • Predictive analytics model for traffic and energy management
  • Case study implementation in Jakarta smart city initiative

The experimental results demonstrate significant improvements in urban resource management efficiency, with 25% reduction in traffic congestion and 30% improvement in energy consumption optimization.
Machine Learning for Smart City Development - ICICT 2024
Comprehensive study on machine learning applications in smart city development through IoT integration and data analytics for urban efficiency.
machine learning, smart city, IoT, data analytics, urban computing, IEEE conference
Sustainable Engineering Solutions for Climate Change Mitigation
Innovation in Green Technology and Environmental Protection
Prof. Dr. Ir. Budi Hartono, Dr. Siti Nurhaliza, M.T., Ir. Made Wirawan, M.Eng.
International Conference on Sustainable Engineering and Environmental Technology
Universitas Indonesia dan ASEAN Engineering Network
Prof. Dr. Ir. Kusmawan Ruswandi, M.Sc.
Advances in Sustainable Engineering and Environmental Technology
Environmental Engineering, Sustainable Technology, Climate Change
sustainability, climate change, green technology, environmental engineering, renewable energy
Best Paper Award - ICSEET 2024 untuk kontribusi luar biasa dalam bidang teknologi berkelanjutan
Makalah ini membahas solusi rekayasa berkelanjutan untuk mitigasi perubahan iklim melalui pengembangan teknologi hijau dan inovasi dalam perlindungan lingkungan.

Abstract

This study investigates sustainable engineering approaches to address climate change challenges through innovative green technologies and environmental protection methodologies. The research proposes comprehensive solutions for sustainable development and carbon footprint reduction.

Research Highlights:

  • Development of carbon-neutral manufacturing processes
  • Integration of renewable energy in industrial systems
  • Waste-to-energy conversion technologies
  • Life cycle assessment of green engineering solutions

The proposed solutions show potential for 40% reduction in industrial carbon emissions and 50% improvement in resource efficiency across multiple sectors.
Sustainable Engineering Solutions for Climate Change - ICSEET 2024
Research on sustainable engineering approaches for climate change mitigation through green technology and environmental protection innovations.
sustainable engineering, climate change, green technology, environmental protection, Springer conference
Innovative Mathematics Teaching Methods in Digital Era
Technology Integration for Enhanced Learning Experience
Dr. Rina Sari, M.Pd., Joko Santoso, S.Pd., M.Ed., Dewi Lestari, M.Pd.
Seminar Nasional Pendidikan Matematika dan Inovasi Pembelajaran
Universitas Negeri Malang dan Asosiasi Guru Matematika Indonesia
mathematics education, digital learning, teaching methods, technology integration, pedagogy innovation
Penelitian ini mengeksplorasi metode pengajaran matematika inovatif di era digital untuk meningkatkan pemahaman dan keterlibatan siswa dalam pembelajaran matematika.

Abstrak

Penelitian ini mengeksplorasi metode pengajaran matematika inovatif di era digital dengan fokus pada integrasi teknologi untuk meningkatkan pengalaman belajar siswa. Studi ini mengevaluasi efektivitas pendekatan berbasis teknologi dalam meningkatkan pemahaman dan keterlibatan siswa.

Metodologi Penelitian:

  • Implementasi platform pembelajaran digital interaktif
  • Penggunaan aplikasi visualisasi matematika
  • Metode pembelajaran berbasis game (gamification)
  • Analisis data pembelajaran dengan learning analytics

Hasil penelitian menunjukkan peningkatan signifikan dalam pemahaman konsep matematika siswa sebesar 35% dan tingkat keterlibatan meningkat 40% dibandingkan metode konvensional.
Innovative Mathematics Teaching in Digital Era - SENDIMAT 2024
Research on innovative mathematics teaching methods using digital technology integration for enhanced student learning experience.
mathematics education, digital learning, teaching innovation, technology integration, SINTA indexed
Blockchain Technology for Enhanced Cybersecurity in Financial Services
A Comprehensive Framework for Secure Digital Transactions
Prof. Dr. Ir. Rudi Harahap, M.Sc., Dr. Lina Marlina, S.Kom., M.T., Agus Setiawan, S.Kom., M.Cs.
Prof. Dr. Ir. Rudi Harahap, M.Sc.
ACM International Conference on Computer and Communications Security
Proceedings of the 2024 ACM SIGSAC Conference on Computer and Communications Security
blockchain, cybersecurity, financial services, distributed systems, cryptography, digital transactions
Penelitian ini mengusulkan framework komprehensif berbasis blockchain untuk meningkatkan keamanan siber dalam layanan keuangan digital dengan fokus pada transaksi yang aman dan terpercaya.

Abstract

This paper proposes a comprehensive blockchain-based framework for enhancing cybersecurity in financial services. Our approach addresses critical security challenges in digital financial transactions through innovative distributed ledger technologies and advanced cryptographic mechanisms.

Key Innovations:

  • Novel consensus mechanism for financial transaction validation
  • Multi-layer security architecture with smart contract integration
  • Advanced cryptographic protocols for privacy preservation
  • Real-time threat detection and response system

Experimental evaluation demonstrates 99.8% security effectiveness against common financial cyber attacks, with 60% improvement in transaction processing speed compared to traditional systems.
Blockchain Cybersecurity for Financial Services - ACM CCS 2024
Comprehensive blockchain framework for enhanced cybersecurity in financial services with advanced cryptographic mechanisms and distributed ledger technology.
blockchain, cybersecurity, financial services, ACM conference, distributed systems, cryptography
Social Media Sentiment Analysis for Public Policy Decision Making
Big Data Analytics Approach for Democratic Governance
Dr. Maya Sari, S.Sos., M.A., Prof. Ir. Andi Prasetyo, M.Si., Dr. Fitri Handayani, S.Kom., M.T.
International Conference on Digital Society and Governance
International Association for Digital Society Research
Procedia Computer Science - Digital Society and Governance
Social Sciences, Public Policy, Data Analytics
Digital Society and Computational Social Science
sentiment analysis, social media, public policy, big data, democratic governance, computational social science
Studi ini mengembangkan metodologi analisis sentimen media sosial untuk mendukung pengambilan keputusan kebijakan publik melalui pendekatan big data analytics dan democratic governance.

Abstract

This study develops a comprehensive methodology for social media sentiment analysis to support public policy decision-making processes. The research leverages big data analytics and machine learning techniques to extract meaningful insights from citizen opinions expressed through social media platforms.

Research Methodology:

  • Multi-platform social media data collection and preprocessing
  • Advanced natural language processing for Indonesian text analysis
  • Real-time sentiment classification and trend analysis
  • Policy impact assessment through sentiment tracking

Case studies on three major policy initiatives show 85% accuracy in predicting public reception and 70% improvement in policy adjustment effectiveness when informed by sentiment analysis results.
Social Media Sentiment Analysis for Public Policy - ICDSG 2024
Comprehensive methodology for social media sentiment analysis supporting public policy decision-making through big data analytics and democratic governance.
Adaptive Learning Systems: AI-Driven Personalized Education
Machine Learning Approaches for Individualized Learning Paths
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Sarah Chen, Ph.D., Dr. Ahmad Wijaya, S.T., M.T.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
International Conference on Artificial Intelligence in Education
Lecture Notes in Computer Science - Artificial Intelligence in Education
Adaptive Learning Systems, Personalized Education, Machine Learning
adaptive learning, personalized education, AI in education, machine learning, learning analytics
Development of AI-driven adaptive learning systems that create personalized learning paths based on individual student performance and learning styles.

Abstract

This paper presents the development and evaluation of adaptive learning systems using artificial intelligence to create personalized education experiences. The system employs machine learning algorithms to analyze student behavior, performance patterns, and learning preferences to dynamically adjust learning content and pacing.

Key Contributions:

  • Novel reinforcement learning approach for curriculum adaptation
  • Multi-modal student modeling incorporating cognitive and affective states
  • Real-time assessment and feedback mechanisms
  • Scalable architecture for large-scale educational deployment

Experimental results show 35% improvement in learning outcomes and 28% increase in student engagement compared to traditional learning management systems.
Adaptive Learning Systems: AI-Driven Personalized Education - AIED 2024
Development of AI-driven adaptive learning systems for personalized education using machine learning approaches.
adaptive learning, AI education, personalized learning, machine learning, Springer
Post-Quantum Cryptography: Implementation and Performance Analysis
Lattice-Based Cryptographic Protocols for Secure Communications
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Michael Schmidt, Ph.D., Dr. Lisa Chen, Ph.D.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
International Conference on Cryptology and Network Security
Lecture Notes in Computer Science - Cryptology and Network Security
Post-Quantum Cryptography, Lattice-Based Cryptography, Quantum Security
post-quantum cryptography, lattice-based cryptography, quantum computing, cryptographic protocols
Implementation and performance analysis of lattice-based cryptographic protocols designed to withstand quantum computing attacks.

Abstract

This paper presents implementation and performance analysis of post-quantum cryptographic protocols based on lattice problems. We evaluate the security and efficiency of various lattice-based signature and key exchange schemes in preparation for the quantum computing era.

Implementation Details:

  • Optimized lattice-based key exchange (Kyber)
  • Digital signature schemes (Dilithium)
  • Hardware acceleration for lattice operations
  • Side-channel attack resistance analysis

Performance benchmarks show that post-quantum schemes achieve acceptable performance overhead while providing quantum-resistant security guarantees.
Implementation and performance analysis of lattice-based post-quantum cryptographic protocols for secure communications.
post-quantum cryptography, lattice cryptography, quantum security, Springer
Optimization of Renewable Energy Systems Using Swarm Intelligence
Particle Swarm Optimization for Hybrid Solar-Wind Power Systems
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Rama Pratama, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Budi Santoso, S.T., M.Kom.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
International Conference on Renewable Energy and Power Engineering
IEEE Proceedings - Renewable Energy and Power Engineering
Renewable Energy Systems, Swarm Intelligence, Optimization
renewable energy, swarm intelligence, particle swarm optimization, solar-wind hybrid, IEEE
Application of particle swarm optimization algorithms for optimal sizing and operation of hybrid solar-wind renewable energy systems.

Abstract

This paper presents optimization of renewable energy systems using swarm intelligence algorithms. We apply particle swarm optimization (PSO) for optimal sizing and operation of hybrid solar-wind power systems to minimize levelized cost of energy while maximizing system reliability.

Optimization Framework:

  • Multi-objective PSO for system sizing
  • Real-time operation optimization
  • Weather prediction integration
  • Battery storage management

Case study results demonstrate 23% cost reduction and 18% improvement in system reliability compared to conventional design approaches.
Renewable Energy Optimization Using Swarm Intelligence - REPE 2024
Particle swarm optimization for hybrid solar-wind renewable energy systems design and operation.
renewable energy, swarm intelligence, PSO, solar-wind hybrid, IEEE
Digital Humanities: Computational Analysis of Literary Texts
Natural Language Processing for Indonesian Literature Analysis
Dr. Maya Sari, S.Sos., M.A., Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Ahmad Wijaya, S.T., M.T.
Digital Humanities, Computational Literary Analysis, Indonesian Literature
digital humanities, computational literary analysis, Indonesian literature, NLP, ACM
Application of natural language processing techniques for computational analysis of Indonesian literary texts and cultural heritage preservation.

Abstract

This paper explores the application of digital humanities methodologies for computational analysis of Indonesian literary texts. We develop NLP pipelines for text analysis, authorship attribution, and thematic pattern recognition in classical and modern Indonesian literature.

Methodology:

  • Corpus construction of Indonesian literary texts
  • Named entity recognition for Indonesian literature
  • Stylometric analysis and authorship attribution
  • Thematic modeling using topic modeling techniques

The study reveals significant patterns in Indonesian literary evolution and provides new insights into cultural and linguistic heritage through computational methods.
Digital Humanities: Computational Analysis of Indonesian Literature - ICDHS 2024
Natural language processing for computational analysis of Indonesian literary texts in digital humanities research.
digital humanities, Indonesian literature, computational analysis, NLP, ACM
Wearable Biosensors for Continuous Health Monitoring
IoT-Enabled Biomedical Devices for Preventive Healthcare
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Siti Nurhaliza, S.T., M.Kom., Dr. Yuki Tanaka, Ph.D.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
International Federation for Medical and Biological Engineering
Wearable Biosensors, IoT Healthcare, Biomedical Devices
wearable biosensors, IoT healthcare, biomedical engineering, continuous monitoring, Springer
Development of IoT-enabled wearable biosensors for continuous health monitoring and preventive healthcare applications.

Abstract

This paper presents the development of wearable biosensors for continuous health monitoring using Internet of Things (IoT) technology. The system integrates multiple physiological sensors with wireless communication and cloud-based data analytics for preventive healthcare applications.

Sensor Integration:

  • Multi-parameter vital sign monitoring
  • ECG and heart rate variability analysis
  • Non-invasive glucose monitoring
  • Activity and sleep pattern tracking

Clinical trials demonstrate 94% accuracy in vital sign monitoring and 87% early detection rate for potential health issues.
Wearable Biosensors for Continuous Health Monitoring - ICBME 2024
IoT-enabled wearable biosensors for continuous health monitoring and preventive healthcare applications.
wearable biosensors, IoT healthcare, biomedical engineering, continuous monitoring, Springer
Climate Change Impact Modeling Using Machine Learning
Predictive Analytics for Environmental Policy and Urban Planning
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Fitri Handayani, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Michael Schmidt, Ph.D.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications
Lecture Notes in Computer Science - Computational Science
Climate Change Modeling, Machine Learning, Environmental Policy
climate change modeling, machine learning, environmental policy, predictive analytics, Springer
Machine learning approaches for climate change impact modeling and predictive analytics supporting environmental policy and urban planning decisions.

Abstract

This paper develops machine learning models for climate change impact assessment and prediction. We integrate multiple data sources including satellite imagery, weather patterns, and socio-economic indicators to create comprehensive predictive models for environmental policy making.

Modeling Approach:

  • Ensemble machine learning for climate prediction
  • Spatial-temporal analysis of environmental data
  • Uncertainty quantification in climate projections
  • Policy impact assessment frameworks

Model validation shows 89% accuracy in predicting local climate impacts and provides actionable insights for urban adaptation planning.
Climate Change Impact Modeling Using Machine Learning - ICCSA 2024
Machine learning models for climate change impact assessment and predictive analytics for environmental policy.
climate change modeling, machine learning, environmental policy, predictive analytics, Springer
Deep Learning for Financial Time Series Prediction
LSTM and Transformer Models for Stock Market Forecasting
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Rama Pratama, S.Kom., M.T., Dr. Sarah Johnson, Ph.D.
Prof. Dr. Mada Rahman, S.Kom., M.T.
Financial Time Series, Deep Learning, Stock Market Prediction
deep learning, financial time series, LSTM, transformers, stock market prediction, ACM
Advanced deep learning models using LSTM and Transformer architectures for accurate stock market forecasting and financial time series prediction.

Abstract

This paper presents advanced deep learning architectures for financial time series prediction. We compare Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks and Transformer models for stock market forecasting, incorporating multiple market indicators and sentiment analysis.

Model Architectures:

  • Multi-layer LSTM with attention mechanisms
  • Transformer-based temporal modeling
  • Multi-modal input integration (price, volume, news)
  • Ensemble prediction strategies

Empirical results demonstrate 68% directional accuracy and 15% improvement over traditional forecasting methods in volatile market conditions.
Deep Learning for Financial Time Series Prediction - ICCF 2024
LSTM and Transformer models for stock market forecasting and financial time series prediction using deep learning.
deep learning, financial time series, LSTM, transformers, stock market prediction, ACM
